Amaeze wrote:
> If the the PUT had no side-effects, then I would see no problem with
> this.

Side-effects do not affect PUT's idempotency.

What is required for PUT is that if you were to do it twice - without 
doing anything in between - that it would have the same basic effect as 
if you'd done it once. Whether that effect affects other resources or 
not, is not an issue.

(Conceptually, one can always imagine a resource that is part of any 
other resource, so one could always conceive of any PUT operation as 
having a side-effect upon that resource).
